en: Canada has more doughnut shops per capita than any other country.

The first Burger King was opened in Florida Miami in 1954.
Chocolate is the number 1 food craved by women.
Honey is the only food that will never rot, it can last 3000 years.
Dark green lettuce leaves are more nutritious than lighter ones.
Carrots contain 0% fat.

9% of people skip breakfast daily.

Most of the Vitamin C found in fruits is in the skin.

The bigger the orange the sweeter it is.

You have to eat 5kg (11lb) of potatoes to put on .5kg (1lb) of weight (a potato has no more calories than an apple).

Thin skinned lemons are the juiciest.

There are around 30 milligrams of caffeine in the average chocolate bar while a cup of coffee has around 100 to 150.
The primary reason for growing rice in flooded paddies is to drown the weeds surrounding the young seedlings (rice can grow in well drained areas).
The shell is 12% of an eggs weight.

Unless food is mixed with saliva you can't taste it.

An egg contains every vitamin except vitamin C.

It takes the food seven seconds to get from your mouth to your stomach.
All species of beetles are edible.

The world's largest burrito weighed 4,217 lbs.
Running cold water over the onion and the knife will keep you from crying when you cut it, because water neutralizes the chemical that makes you cry.
A scientist at Michigan State University has calculated that the production of a single hen egg requires about 120 gallons of water, a loaf of bread requires 300 gallons, and a pound of beef, 3,500.
Milk delivered to the store today was in the cow two days ago.

The English word "soup" comes from the Middle Ages word "sop" which means a slice of bread over which roast drippings were poured. The first archaeological evidence of soup being consumed dates back to 6000 B.C., with the main ingredient being Hippopotamus bones!
Seedless oranges were not grown in the United States until 1871. The first ones came from Brazil and were planted in California.
An average ear of corn has 800 kernels, arranged in 16 rows.
The "heat" of peppers is rated on the Scoville scale.

Coca-Cola contained Coca (whose active ingredient is cocaine) from 1885 to 1903.

The first "Oreo" was sold in 1912.
The apricot can be traced back to China at least four thousand years ago, and it first appeared in Greek mythology as the "golden apple".
